The market is full of reasonably priced growth stocks.

The definition of growth stock varies widely, but I think it should include all companies that are growing faster than the broader market. This sets the growth rate at about 10% or more, which is still a large section of the stock market. While growth stocks can be found in all corners of the market, the tech sector is a great place to look, as there are often some incredible companies with innovative technology rapidly taking market share.

news.headline: Why Verizon Is Firing 13,000 Employees, in the Company’s Own Words
news.summary: News that  Verizon  was conducting its largest layoff to date made headlines last week.  Chief Executive Daniel Schulman said in an email to staff early Thursday morning that Verizon has begun shedding “more than 13,000 employees across the organization,” and is seeking to “significantly reduce” outside labor costs like outsourced jobs.  This letter, with the subject line “Building a stronger Verizon,” reviewed by Barron’s and confirmed as legitimate by the company, appears to be the company’s first official written communication about the cuts.
